channel.title: Googlewhack's
channel.description:
Anyone know what these are? If not i will explain to you. Basically a googlwhack is something you serch on google with 1 result here are the rules for Googlewhacks
What? What?! Visit [URL=http://www.google.com]Google[/URL]. Submit a query of two words, but don't use quote marks. (Quotes tell Google to find the enclosed words immediately adjacent - and that's just too easy!) Use no punctuation in your words, and no numbers (just 26 letters from A through Z). Find two words that return one result, then see whether Whack agrees (Whack may not see the same results you see). Whack only accepts words between 4 and 30 characters in length. (Any shorter or longer, again, that's just too easy!) [u]What are the rules?[/u] [b]Rule Number One: [/b] Your two Googlefactors must exist in Google's view of legitimate words in this [URL=http://www.answers.com/]dictionary[/URL]. Not your view; Google's view! Google does the work, and Google has the final word on what may be legitimate! In the blue bar atop your Google results, accepted terms are linked, and so appear 'underlined.' No line, no link, or no legitimate word = Googlejack! (As in, You've got jack, so see the FAQ :-) [b]Rule Number Two:[/b] Google also is the arbiter of a whack's uniqueness. Look to the right end of the blue bar atop your Google results. If you see "Results 1 - 1 of (any number),' you found exactly one hit = Googlewhack! [b]Rule Number Three:[/b] Google shows you an excerpt of the page you whacked. Look at that text. If it's merely a list of words (such as a bibliography, concordance, encyclopedia, glossary, thesaurus, dictionary, domain names, or plain old machine-generated random garbage), No Whack For You! If your Googlefactors don't comply, some other whacker will certainly test them, then expose your treachery to all! Entries in The Whack Stack that breach Rule Number Three will be marked WORDLIST :-(. If you record offensive comments in The Whack Stack, I may remove or change them at my discretion. Excessive stacking of the same word may cause Whack to ban the word automatically for over 48 hours. Inappropriate use or abuse of the service may result in your whacks being removed. Deal with it. "Inappropriate use or abuse" may include the use of tokens which are not legitimate words. When complaints or comments point to inappropriate use, Whack's behavior may change without notice. Note: When you search Google, you may be able to find more reliable Googlewhacks by prefixing each word in your Google search with a "+" (for example, +endothelial +velveeta). It's not required, but may make whacking easier. Whack always has submitted queries that require an exact match. That is, Whack always has prefixed both words with "+" to require their presence, which (later, serendipitously) also avoided any stemming by Google. The rules here always have been correct; entries in The Whack Stack always have been consistent with the rules. You're welcome to post your crack Googlewhack in The Whack Stack. To do so, first head over to Google to find a whack you like. Then, you can use [URL=http://www.googlewhack.com/hello.htm]Whack![/URL], which checks the rules for you! (It will record a true success, but if you find more than a few results, it will send you to Google where you belong :-) If you can't satisfy Whack!, you're welcome to post your slightly slack Googlewhack to QuickTopic. (This is especially for those hardcore Scrabble players who just know "That's a real word," even though Google's reference may not agree :-)
So there you go, now you can find some and submit them for the world to see, but once you submit one it won't be a googlewhack anymore because it will be posted on various sites etc so guard it closely until you decide to submit. But remember it must adhere to the rules. Here is a link to their [URL=http://www.googlewhack.com/fhack.htm]FAQ site[/URL] just in case you are confused

item.title: Googlewhack's
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

ok, all that matters is that googlewhack.com accepted it and i spent at least half an hour on it, lol. and sanga, yes, it asks if you meant ununbium heptahydrate, but it also gives one (and only one) result, and its not a wordlist, go to the link its some kind of blog i think.

EDIT: upon further review, it is a wordlist, but i could have sworn it wasnt yesterday…

Read full topic

item.title: Googlewhack's
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

So? Search for the second word on its own, and it’s there in the dictionary.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:8, topic:220425”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=289453.msg2338604#msg2338604 date=1216226461]

i got one: ununbium heptahedral

no sorry google doesn’t agree with the second word
[/quote]

Uh, yes it does…[/quote]
i search it and get

Did you mean: ununbium heptahydrate

Read full topic

no sorry google doesn’t agree with the second word[/quote]

item.title: Googlewhack's
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:220425”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=289453.msg2336724#msg2336724 date=1216138270]
So there you go, now you can find some and submit them for the world to see, but once you submit one it won’t be a googlewhack anymore because it will be posted on various sites etc so guard it closely until you decide to submit.
[/quote]

This shouldn’t happen… those sites should make sure the whack pages don’t get indexed.[/quote]
yeah but it does, because if its found on one site other sites add it aswell and forums have it etc so basically it does get put up again

Read full topic

item.title: Googlewhack's
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

sanga282:

So there you go, now you can find some and submit them for the world to see, but once you submit one it won’t be a googlewhack anymore because it will be posted on various sites etc so guard it closely until you decide to submit.

This shouldn’t happen… those sites should make sure the whack pages don’t get indexed.
